====November 7: Deposits $20,000 into Wells Fargo====
+
====November 7: $20,000 from [[Occupy Wall Street]]====
â
On November 7, Occupy Oakland deposited $20,000 into Wells Fargo, whose policies Occupy Oakland had protested a few days earlier. The money had been donated to Occupy Oakland by Occupy Wall Street for urgent medical and legal expenses. The Occupy Oakland general assembly approved the decision to hold it temporarily in a Wells Fargo account so that they could draw from it immediately while the group waits on the state to finalize its status as an unincorporated association able to hold funds. At that point, the money will be moved to a local credit union. Wells Fargo spokesman Ruben Pulido said that this deposit "demonstrates that even Occupy Oakland understands â firsthand â the value and service that Wells Fargo provides its customers. Wells Fargo welcomes the 100 percent of Americans to allow us to help them meet their financial needs."<ref>[http://www.sfexaminer.com/local/2011/11/occupy-oakland-makes-20k-deposit-wells-fargo Occupy Oakland makes $20K deposit at Wells Fargo], San Francisco Examiner, November 8, 2011</ref>
+
On November 7, Occupy Oakland deposited $20,000 for "urgent medical and legal expensive" from Occupy Wall Street. Pending formation of a non-profit, the money was held in the accounts of its attorneys. The movement suffered a minor embarrassment when it learned that the account was held by Well's Fargo-- itself a target of the Occupy movement. The Oakland General Assembly subsequently released a statement clarifying that the funds would indeed be transferred to a local credit union. <ref>[http://www.sfexaminer.com/local/2011/11/occupy-oakland-makes-20k-deposit-wells-fargo Occupy Oakland makes $20K deposit at Wells Fargo], San Francisco Examiner, November 8, 2011</ref><ref>[http://www.occupyoakland.org/generalassembly/committees/ Occupy Oakland General Assembly statement on $20,000 donation]</ref>
====November 9: Oakland City Council press conference and counter-demonstration====
====November 9: Oakland City Council press conference and counter-demonstration====
